Class Context

Contains common information and parameters for the judge. This is passed around in lieu of using globals.

Hierarchy

  • Context
  • Defined in packages/core/src/context.ts:61

Properties

accelerationFactor

accelerationFactor: Acceleration

The acceleration factor, used to speed up (or slow down) execution in the VM.

There is a limit on how much you can increase this, since each step in the VM must still have time to run of course.

  • Defined in packages/core/src/context.ts:90

actionTimeout: number

The timeout for the actions.

Methods

accelerateEvent

  • accelerateEvent<T>(number: number | T): number | T

  • Accelerate a certain number. This is intended for events.

    Type Parameters

    • T

    Parameters

    • number: number | T

      The number to accelerate. All non-numbers are returned as is.

    Returns number | T

    • Defined in packages/core/src/context.ts:515

accelerateTimer

  • accelerateTimer(): void

  • Adjust the given method on the given device to account for the acceleration factor.

    This is mainly used to reverse accelerate the project timer. E.g. if the project timer is counts 10s for a project with acceleration factor 2, it should count 20s instead.

    Returns void

    • Defined in packages/core/src/context.ts:500

deinstrumentVm

  • deinstrumentVm(): void

  • Remove all instrumentations from the VM. This should restore the VM to its original state.

    Returns void

    • Defined in packages/core/src/context.ts:421

instrumentVm

  • instrumentVm(logMode?: LogMode): void

  • Instrument the VM, based on the log mode.

    Parameters

    • logMode: LogMode = 'judge'

    Returns void

    • Defined in packages/core/src/context.ts:408

runVm

  • runVm(): void

  • Prepare the VM for execution for the judge.

    This will prepare the answers for questions (if applicable) and instrument the VM to take the acceleration factor into account.

    Returns void

    • Defined in packages/core/src/context.ts:434

  • terminate(): void

  • Returns void
